title: Teriyaki tofu
author: Danny Burrow
instructions: Press excess water from tofu. Cut into bite-size pieces. Dredge in cornflour. Deep fry. Drain excess oil, then coat in teriyaki sauce. Serve over rice.

title: BBQ Pulled Pork
author: Danny Burrow
instructions: Pat pork shoulder dry and liberally coat with salt and spices. Place on a rack in oven at 225F for 8-12 hours, until roast is fall-apart tender. Cool slightly, then shred. Mix with skimmed and strained pan drippings as desired.

title: Grilled Chicken
author: Habeebah Aleilo
instructions: Marinate the chicken with a blend of spices, herbs, salt, and oil, let it sit for at least an hour, then grill over medium heat until golden brown and fully cooked, turning occasionally.

title: Goat Nyamachoma
author: Bilha Wambugu
instructions: Fry red onions until golden brown. Add pre-boiled peas, tomatoes, and the mixed capsicum. Cook for 3 minutes. Add 1.5 cups of rice and 3 cups of water. Let it cook for 20 mins on low heat. Let the water evaporate completely. Serve with goat meat or grilled chicken.

title: Jollof Rice and Chicken
author: Jemi Tigo
instructions: Add rice to already prepared stew with a little water. Leave to cook for about 40 minutes. Serve with grilled chicken.

title: Ugali with Sukuma Wiki
author: Kevin Yegon
instructions: Boil water and gradually add maize flour while stirring continuously with a cooking stick until thick and firm. In another pan, sauté chopped onions and tomatoes in oil, then add chopped sukuma wiki and salt. Stir and cook for about 5-7 minutes until tender. Serve hot with the ugali.

title: Fried Plantains
author: Kwame Mensah
instructions: Peel plantains and slice diagonally. Heat oil in a pan. Fry plantains until golden brown. Sprinkle with salt and serve hot.

title: Creamy Garlic Mashed Potatoes
author: Sasha Karim
instructions: Boil peeled potatoes with garlic until tender. Drain and mash with butter and warm milk. Season with salt and pepper. Mix until creamy.

title: Chickpea Salad
author: Layla Hassan
instructions: Rinse chickpeas. Dice vegetables and mix in a bowl. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil. Add salt and pepper to taste. Chill before serving.

title: Coconut Curry Lentils
author: Priya Sharma
instructions: Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger. Add curry powder and stir. Add lentils and coconut milk. Simmer until lentils are soft. Add salt to taste and serve with rice.

title: Beef Stir Fry
author: Liu Chen
instructions: Marinate beef in soy sauce, garlic, and ginger. Stir-fry beef until browned. Add sliced vegetables and cook until tender-crisp. Thicken sauce with cornflour and serve with rice or noodles.

title: YAM and EGG
author: Sherifah Hassan
instructions: Peel the yam and cut into slices. Boil the yam in a pot of water with a pinch of salt and sugar until soft. In a separate pan, heat vegetable oil and fry the egg until scrambled. Serve the yam with the scrambled egg on top.

title: Egusi Soup with Pounded Yam
author: Michael Agwogie
instructions: Boil the meat, stock fish, and dry fish with seasoning until tender. In a separate pot, heat palm oil and add blended onions and peppers. Stir in ground egusi and fry for a few minutes. Add the cooked meat and stock, stir, and let it simmer until thickened. Add vegetables and cook for a few more minutes. Serve hot with pounded yam.

title: Vegetable Samosas
author: Aisha Khan
instructions: Boil and mash potatoes. Mix with peas, grated carrots, and spices. Cut pastry sheets into triangles, fill with mixture, and seal. Deep fry until golden brown.

title: Pasta Primavera
author: Marco Rossi
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Sauté garlic in olive oil, add sliced vegetables, and cook until tender. Toss with pasta and sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
author: Emily Johnson
instructions: Cream butter and sugars together. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix in dry ingredients. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet and bake at 350F for 10-12 minutes.

title: Caesar Salad
author: Darlington Obioha
instructions: Wash and chop romaine lettuce. Toss with croutons, parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing. Season with black pepper to taste. Serve chilled.

title: Gari Soakings
author: Nathan Turkson
instructions: Pour some gari into a cup. Add three table spoons of sugar. Add five tablespoons of milk. Pour some water into it and add some grounduts.
